metadata.title: HR1 (OBBBA) SNAP Work Requirements Changes
metadata.notes: All policy details verified against USDA FNS guidance and legislative text. Population estimates marked where data verification is needed.

population_affected.methodology: Based on SNAP participants ages 55-64 who do not have dependent children under 14
population_affected.verification_note: Population estimate needs to be cross-referenced with latest USDA demographic data

pre_hr1.description: Parents with any dependent child under 18 were exempt from work requirements

post_hr1.description: Parents with dependent children ages 14-17 now subject to work requirements

population_affected.description: Parents with children ages 14-17 only (no younger children)
population_affected.verification_note: Need to verify count of SNAP households with children 14-17 but no children under 14

veterans.description: Veterans were previously exempt from ABAWD work requirements. This exemption was removed under HR1.

population_affected.verification_note: Need age breakdown of veterans on SNAP to determine how many are ages 18-64 without qualifying exemptions

homeless.description: Homeless individuals were previously exempt. Under HR1, they must meet work requirements despite lacking stable housing.

population_affected.source: HUD Point-in-Time Count cross-referenced with SNAP participation
population_affected.verification_note: HUD counts homeless populations, but overlap with SNAP participation is not well documented

foster_youth.description: Young adults who aged out of foster care (ages 18-24) were previously exempt. This exemption was removed.

population_affected.source: HHS foster care statistics and SNAP participation estimates
population_affected.verification_note: Estimate based on ~20,000 youth aging out annually and SNAP participation rates

pregnant.description: Pregnant individuals remain exempt from work requirements

disabled.description: Individuals receiving disability benefits remain exempt

medically_certified.description: Individuals medically certified as unable to work remain exempt

caring_for_incapacitated.description: Individuals caring for an incapacitated household member remain exempt

tribal_members.description: Tribal members (as defined under Indian Health Care Improvement Act) are newly exempt under HR1

hours_breakdown.workfare: Unpaid work in exchange for benefits

time_limit.description: Can only receive 3 months of benefits in any 36-month period unless meeting work requirements

documentation: Monthly reporting to state SNAP office

usda_guidance.description: Target date for detailed USDA implementation guidance

state_enforcement.description: Most states began enforcement checks at recertification
state_enforcement.exceptions: CA, DC, Guam, IL, NV, Virgin Islands have waivers delaying enforcement

first_terminations.description: First possible month for benefit terminations due to work requirement non-compliance
first_terminations.note: Actual termination timing varies by individual recertification schedule

waiver_criteria_change.pre_hr1: States could request waivers for areas with insufficient jobs (discretionary standard)
waiver_criteria_change.post_hr1: Waivers only available for areas with 10% unemployment rate or higher (much stricter threshold)
